title: Wilson's tales of the borders and of Scotland :
author: Wilson, John Mackay
snippet: Next morning, as ready and able as usual for th(3 work of the day, he was at his desk about eleven, and when engaged with one client, while others were waiting to be despatclied in the way in which he alone could discharge clients, ho was waited on by a gentleman connected with the Crown Office. Having been yielded a preference, the official took his seat.

title: The World According to Bertie
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: And there was the additional issue of whether or not any of the defences normally available in a criminal trial would be able to be applied to a dog. Nobody at the Crown Office seemed to know!"
